newsitem.title: UK: BA's Feb. traffic, load factor rise.
newsitem.headline: BA's Feb. traffic, load factor rise.

text.p: British Airways Plc said on Wednesday its paying passenger traffic in February rose 6.9 percent, while passenger load factor increased 1.4 points to 68.7 percent versus the year-ago month.
Britain's national flag carrier said it had a 6.1 percent rise in its premium business for the month and non-premium traffic growth of 7.0 percent.
Cargo tonne kilometres rose 9.2 percent in February, resulting in an increase of 7.2 percent in total mainline scheduled revenue tonne kilometres.

This February was shorter than last year's due to 1996 being a leap year, the company added.
